comments:
It also fails in non-nested scenarios.
Steps to reproduce:

Include a call to a non-existant function.
Call code assist and select the correction: created method.
Nothing is done.

what build are you using? I can't reproduce this with 3.0
I think you are refereing to quick fix, not code assist.

For the given example the only quick fix I get is 'create method'. Note 
that 'create methid in enclosing class' is only available for methods in 
anonymous classes.

can you also check the .log file? Also have a look if something is shown in 
the status line.

Sorry, it was quick fix (Ctrl+1).
I'm using Eclipse 3.0 final.
No message in the status line.
If the method to be created resides in another class, Eclipse correctly switches
to that editor, but no new method is appended to the source code.

The following appears in the log file (not sure if it belongs to this problem or
not):

It seems you installed the 1.5 preview. quick fix and refactoring from 3.0 do 
not support this yet, but you can get an updated version, cheetah 6 it is 
called (I think it is available on the update site)

Created an attachment (id=13139)
My configuration

Here you can see what my configuration has, and which plugins are loaded.

I haven't installed any 1.5 preview.
Only 3.0 final with some plugins for version control, Tomcat launching, and a
few more, some tasks I need.
Sorry I installed cheetah inadvertendly through Software updates.
